availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert J. Dabney (Harrison County, Kentucky, coach maker, druggist, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, coach maker, druggist, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married Sarah A. Beadles Dabney in Woodford County, Kentucky, on December 7, 1847. Coach maker in Woodford County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Druggist in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Harrison County in 1862. Druggist in Harrison County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 2, p. 462A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 2, p. 3 of 34 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 564.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 66.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252320, p. 118.
"Sarah A. Dabney (1829-1849)," Find A Grave, Memorial #100832644, accessed November 21, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100832644.
KYR-0001-031-0046.
